publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3074 Linda Fabiani: Release of Aung San Suu Kyi-That the Parliament welcomes the release of Aung San Suu Kyi from house arrest; hopes that this event heralds a move towards democracy in Burma and the beginning of a process of bringing basic freedoms to the people of Burma, and calls upon the international community to provide political and technical support and encouragement to the Burmese people in this time of transition. Supported by: Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-3074 Release of Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 7 May 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Michael Matheson*, Alex Neil*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Robert Brown*

S1M-3074 Linda Fabiani: Release of Aung San Suu Kyi-That the Parliament welcomes the release of Aung San Suu Kyi from house arrest; hopes that this event heralds a move towards democracy in Burma and the beginning of a process of bringing basic freedoms to the people of Burma, and calls upon the international community to provide political and technical support and encouragement to the Burmese people in this time of transition. Supported by: Fiona Hyslop, Stewart Stevenson, Michael Matheson, Alex Neil, Mr Keith Raffan, Robert Brown, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3074 Release of Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 7 May 2002) Shona Robison*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-3074 Release of Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 7 May 2002) Michael Russell*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Ms Margo MacDonald*, Bill Butler*
S1M-3074 Release of Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 7 May 2002) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-3074 Release of Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 7 May 2002) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3074 Release of Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 7 May 2002) Pauline McNeill*
S1M-3074 Release of Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 7 May 2002) Elaine Smith*
S1M-3074 Release of Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 7 May 2002) Brian Adam*
